children.text: The power and wealth of some American companies operating in new technologies challenge some States all around the world. The acronym Gafam, who represent the biggest ones: Apple, Google, Amazon, Facebook and Microsoft could incorporate other companies which are symbols of digital economy. It includes Airbnb, Netflix, Uber or even Zoom, the online meeting software that has grown exponentially during the Covid-19 pandemic.

The figures of this domination are overwhelming. Apple, have been a major actor of the personal digital development in the 1980's, before investing in the online music domain in 2003 with Itunes Music Store and the Smartphones market with the launch of the Iphone in 2007. In 2018, its capitalisation was reaching 1000 billion dollars, the equivalent of Indonesia's gross domestic product, until it exceeds France's one, in 2020, with a capitalisation of 2000 billion dollars.

Created in 1998, Google was managing from the following year 500 000 queries a day, a figure that has now risen to 6,9 billions (80 000 by seconds). The company owns today about 90% of the queries market.

The third internet giant, Amazon, created in 1994, has become in few years a worldwide supermarket, weighing about 45% of the American online commerce in 2019 and 22% of the worldwide online commerce in 2022. Its development accelerated a lot during the Covid-19 pandemic since during the second trimester of 2020, Amazon was the first French e-commerce website. At this time, 65% of the French population bought their digital and electronic products through Amazon. In the USA, Amazon would hold 75% of the electronic books market , making his founder and first general director, Jeff Bezos, one of the wealthiest man of the globe.
Facebook, social media created in 2004, has reached 1,8 daily billion users in 2020, including 28 millions in France and 2,7 monthly billion users.
Microsoft, created in 1975 is today worldwide leader in the computers and exploitation system domain , with an estimated market share of 90%. Microsoft
is also present in sectors as search engines, social medias or video games.

Gafams are in reality only the wave that hides the ocean: behind them, there are a max of American companies, more often localised in the Silicon Valley, in California. Gafams are dominating their sector but are stidely expanding their reach, thus continuing to dictate the rules of the game. We can see this, for example, with Amazon and its catalogue of more than 4,000 films, made available to customers of the Amazon Prime service, which has also acquired the rights to broadcast sporting events (Roland-Garros, First football league in France).

post.description: Apple, Google, Amazon, Facebook and Microsoft: richer than many States, powerful by their billions of users, have they become the sword arm of American expansionism?
post.title: Digital: unlimited power?
